issue.name: LOCAL_A_TAG_RULE
issue.message: File 'page2.html' (relative to 'index.html') referenced by the 'href' attribute in the 'a' tag is missing
issue.explanation:
All local files referenced by the `href` attribute of the `` tag should exist. With this small site structure: site | index.html | page1.html | +---css | style1.css | +---img | pict1.png | \---js script1.js If `index.html` contains this content:

Link to a page.

Link to a page with anchor.

Link to an other page.

Link to a page with wrong anchor.

The first `` tag does not trigger any ERROR, because the file `page1.html` exists. If `page1.html` contains the anchor `abc` then the link `page1.html#abc` is also valid, and no ERROR is created for the second `` tag. The third `` tag triggers an ERROR, because there is no file `page2.html`. If `page1.html` does not contain the anchor `xyz`, the fourth `` tag triggers an ERROR. Remote files (for example starting with `https://`) are not checked by this rule.

Link to a page with anchor.

Link to an other page.

Link to a page with wrong anchor.

The first `` tag does not trigger any ERROR, because the file `page1.html` exists. If `page1.html` contains the anchor `abc` then the link `page1.html#abc` is also valid, and no ERROR is created for the second `` tag. The third `` tag triggers an ERROR, because there is no file `page2.html`. If `page1.html` does not contain the anchor `xyz`, the fourth `` tag triggers an ERROR. Remote files (for example starting with `https://`) are not checked by this rule.

issue.name: LOCAL_IMG_TAG_RULE
issue.message: File 'img/pict2.png' (relative to 'index.html') referenced by the 'src' attribute in the 'img' tag is missing
issue.explanation:
All local files referenced by the `src` attribute of the `` tag should exist. With this small site structure: site | index.html | page1.html | +---css | style1.css | +---img | pict1.png | \---js script1.js If `index.html` contains this content:

First image: .

Second image: .

The first `` tag does not trigger any ERROR, because the file `img/pict1.png` exists. The second `` tag triggers an ERROR, because there is no file `img/pict2.png`. Remote resources (for example starting with `https://`) are not checked by this rule.

issue.name: LOCAL_LINK_TAG_RULE
issue.message: File 'css/style2.css' (relative to 'index.html') referenced by the 'href' attribute in the 'link' tag is missing
issue.explanation:
All local files referenced by the `href` attribute of the `<link>` tag should exist.
With this small site structure:
site | index.html | page1.html | +---css | style1.css | +---img | pict1.png | \---js script1.js
If `index.html` contains this content:
<head> <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/style1.css"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/style2.css"> <!-- ... --> </head>
The first `<link>` tag does not trigger any ERROR, because the file `css/style1.css` exists.
The second `<link>` tag triggers an ERROR, because there is no file `css/style2.css`.
Remote resources (for example starting with `https://`) are not checked by this rule.

issue.name: LOCAL_LINK_TAG_RULE
issue.message: File 'favicon.ico' (relative to 'index.html') referenced by the 'href' attribute in the 'link' tag is missing
issue.explanation:
All local files referenced by the `href` attribute of the `<link>` tag should exist.
With this small site structure:
site | index.html | page1.html | +---css | style1.css | +---img | pict1.png | \---js script1.js
If `index.html` contains this content:
<head> <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/style1.css"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/style2.css"> <!-- ... --> </head>
The first `<link>` tag does not trigger any ERROR, because the file `css/style1.css` exists.
The second `<link>` tag triggers an ERROR, because there is no file `css/style2.css`.
Remote resources (for example starting with `https://`) are not checked by this rule.

issue.name: LOCAL_SCRIPT_TAG_RULE
issue.message: File 'js/script2.js' (relative to 'index.html') referenced by the 'src' attribute in the 'script' tag is missing
issue.explanation:
All local files referenced by the `src` attribute of the `<script>` tag should exist.
With this small site structure:
site | index.html | page1.html | +---css | style1.css | +---img | pict1.png | \---js script1.js
If `index.html` contains this content:
<head> <!-- ... --> <script type="text/javascript" src="js/script1.js"></script> <script src="js/script2.js"></script> <!-- ... --> </head>
The first `<script>` tag does not trigger any ERROR, because the file `js/script1.js` exists.
The second `<script>` tag triggers an ERROR, because there is no file `js/script2.js`.
Remote resources (for example starting with `https://`) are not checked by this rule.

issue.name: LOCAL_SCRIPT_TAG_RULE
